Articles.Content:
This is a series where I will explain and delve into some things about science and so forth... think of it like a science fiction show... And thanks to Some_Random_Guy I've got some visuals so I hope you enjoy these videos .

So if there is anyone else who would like to help- let me know...

Also- if there is anyone who would like to see me do more of this- let me know of that as well . I'll make be making videos every Monday *potentially* Wednesday and Friday unless something comes up. At which point I will notify you guys.

Crew:

Some_Random_Guy (Video Maker/Editor)

Videos!

Video not yet made

Upcoming videos!:

Laika vs Ham

Explaining the Orion (made- awaiting video edits)

Orion vs Apollo (made- awaiting video edits)

Saturn V vs N1

Lunar Module Design

Space Shuttle History

ISS Assembly

Experimental Rocket Engines

Unused Apollo Missions

If you have any thoughts or any ideas you want me to do- please let me know and I may add it!!

Please let me know and enjoy my videos and if you want to see more .

Current as of 12/30/14

Edited December 30, 2014 by ZooNamedGames
I can do some fact-checking and peer review, if you'd like. That tends to be the most important stage that so many neglect.

I can do some fact-checking and peer review, if you'd like. That tends to be the most important stage that so many neglect.

Definitely . Want to be an actual member tho? You know- episode to episode? Make sure you get YOUR credit too.
I don't think I have that sort of time to commit.

I don't think I have that sort of time to commit.

Ah well thanks for the effort tho .
I'm willing to watch. Where should I plug in?

I'm willing to watch. Where should I plug in?

These should be available through Youtube.
I know this is sad- but would anyone mind adverting? Since even though it will look pretty bad (any help is still accepted) it will be some awesome work.
Plan is to record the first lecture tomorrow. If all goes well...
I will be sure to see it. I also can try to help if you need it, but am unsure of regular avaliability. (Rather I am sure of irregular availability).

I will be sure to see it. I also can try to help if you need it, but am unsure of regular avaliability. (Rather I am sure of irregular availability).

Well any help is better than none.
You were actually serious? Wow...I'll help. Imma steam message you.

Yeah ... what did you think I was doing?
First videos being uploaded...
New video here! And on the OP!

Also- the first REAL video is also on the OP...

another thing- how do you spoiler things? I've tried

and it didn't do anything

Not bad for an intro. If you'd prefer, you can follow people like Scott Manley or Vsauce in their presentation methods, which is lecturing an idea while presenting a slide show and/or snippets from other videos/web page/historical documents. May need some work on visuals, but it won't be as complicated as full-fledged animations. I can't help much on that front, though, other than sharing ideas and pointing out flaws.

Not bad for an intro. If you'd prefer, you can follow people like Scott Manley or Vsauce in their presentation methods, which is lecturing an idea while presenting a slide show and/or snippets from other videos/web page/historical documents. May need some work on visuals, but it won't be as complicated as full-fledged animations. I can't help much on that front, though, other than sharing ideas and pointing out flaws.

Well remember- a slideshow *may* cause my computer to make me and it so- like igasp inmas blups... So that may not be an option however in speech style maybe but visuals has been my issue from the beginning...

Btw I had to reduce FPS from 30 to 5 to make it run smoothly if that has any remorse (oh and the only thing open outside of OBS was Internet Explorer and a handful of forum tabs).

Also- the first REAL video is also on the OP...

and it didn't do anything

Well remember- a slideshow *may* cause my computer to make me and it so- like igasp inmas blups... So that may not be an option however in speech style maybe but visuals has been my issue from the beginning...

Btw I had to reduce FPS from 30 to 5 to make it run smoothly if that has any remorse (oh and the only thing open outside of OBS was Internet Explorer and a handful of forum tabs).

You could, say, pre-record the slideshow sans voice, and dub the speech in afterwards. Yes, I know it may not be easy from your end, but listening to a monologue accompanied by only a single still picture can hardly impress any audience; words alone can only explain so much.

At the very least, you could use a decent camera to record yourself talking in front of a whiteboard or some other media, while simultaneously showing some pictures relevant to or demonstrating your idea, either in the form of drawings, physical large pictures being shuffled around, or an office-meeting-style Powerpoint presentation.

Remember, you're attempting to lecture people on science. How would you feel when having to attend a class in which the lecturer simply reads off a book or slideshow without bothering to explain, elaborate, simplify (where appropriate), and articulate the ideas he's trying to teach?

I have a great computer set up, If you want me to record maybe background footage, or possibly edit some of the video I can. You can use screenshots of your research and put them on the screen maybe over some gameplay of the new update(When I play I'm gonna record some stuff)

Message me on Steam when you get on

I'd love it if you would- so does that mean you want to join my crew?

You could, say, pre-record the slideshow sans voice, and dub the speech in afterwards. Yes, I know it may not be easy from your end, but listening to a monologue accompanied by only a single still picture can hardly impress any audience; words alone can only explain so much.

At the very least, you could use a decent camera to record yourself talking in front of a whiteboard or some other media, while simultaneously showing some pictures relevant to or demonstrating your idea, either in the form of drawings, physical large pictures being shuffled around, or an office-meeting-style Powerpoint presentation.

Remember, you're attempting to lecture people on science. How would you feel when having to attend a class in which the lecturer simply reads off a book or slideshow without bothering to explain, elaborate, simplify (where appropriate), and articulate the ideas he's trying to teach?

Two things- A- Your comparison slightly off- Its more like the teacher is teaching but you lack the book or anything else to follow along. So your only source of info is the teacher.

and B- Have I not asked for help in OP for this kind of thing? If its visuals alone your worried about then I can fix that by letting Some_Random_Guy do it for me.
New video coming tomorrow on the topic of: The Gemini Program.
